verses.plain: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

tokens.t: , rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verses.plain: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.

tokens.t: , heal me; for my bones are vexed.

verses.plain: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?

tokens.t: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O

verses.plain: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.

tokens.t: , deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies’ sake.

verses.plain: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

tokens.t: no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

verses.plain: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

tokens.t: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

verses.plain: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

tokens.t: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

verses.plain: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

tokens.t: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the
hath heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.plain: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.

tokens.t: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return
